thread.title: It’s Not Too Late To Support Us In 2023
thread.title_full: It’s Not Too Late To Support Us In 2023

author: The Editors
title: It’s Not Too Late To Support Us In 2023
text: [It’s almost the end of the year, and almost your last opportunity in 2023 ](https://i0.wp.com/theimaginativeconservative.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/Screen-Shot-2023-12-29-at-4.23.41-PM.png?ssl=1) [to support ](https://theimaginativeconservative.us7.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bc7b2d39b5cb48efac063e5&id=db7207a554&e=25555cc2bf) [The Imaginative Conservative](https://theimaginativeconservative.us7.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bc7b2d39b5cb48efac063e5&id=3ef2a54a0b&e=25555cc2bf). Our journal is now more than thirteen years old. Perhaps you have traveled with us since that day in 2010 when we embarked on our mission is to preserve the transcendentals, the “permanent things” that constitute the glory of Western Civilization. Or perhaps you joined us mid-voyage in our fight for that which sustains us: virtue, law and order, truth, beauty, and goodness. Maybe you have just climbed aboard as a reader recently and have newly discovered our reasoned, reflective essays on issues of faith and culture, imagination and liberal learning, economics and politics, written by some great minds of both the present and the past. No matter how far and how long you have journeyed with us, we are grateful for your fellowship, and we raise a toast to you, recalling the words of William Cullen Bryant’s “A Song for New Year’s Eve”: Even while we sing, he smiles his last, And leaves our sphere behind. The good old year is with the past; Oh be the new as kind! Will you support our important mission by [making a contribution today](https://www.paypal.com/donate/?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=5XB3QPV5AHZ98&mc_cid=4d44a9a8a6&mc_eid=UNIQID&ssrt=1703624641338)? For your consideration: PILLAR: $25,000 and higher BENEFACTOR: $10,000–$24,999 LEADER: $5,000–$9,999 PATRIOT: $1,000–$4,999 FRIEND: $500–$999 SUPPORTER: $25-499 The Imaginative Conservative is sponsored by The Free Enterprise Institute. Your donation to the Institute in support of The Imaginative Conservative is tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law (by mail: 9600 Long Point Rd., Suite 300, Houston, TX, 77055). The featured image is “Pastor Sören blows out the candle on the New Year’s Eve” (c. 1900) by Hans Smidth, and is in the public domain, courtesy of [Wikimedia Commons](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Hans_Smidth_-_Pastor_S%C3%B6ren_blows_out_the_candle_on_the_New_Year%27s_Eve_-_KMS3382_-_Statens_Museum_for_Kunst.jpg). All comments are moderated and must be civil, concise, and constructive to the conversation. Comments that are critical of an essay may be approved, but comments containing ad hominem criticism of the author will not be published. Also, comments containing web links or block quotations are unlikely to be approved. Keep in mind that essays represent the opinions of the authors and do not necessarily reflect the views of The Imaginative Conservative or its editor or publisher.
